description: From Ancient Greek μετωνυμικός (metōnumikós, “of or like metonymy”), from μετωνυμία (metōnumía, “change of name”), from μετά (metá, “other”) + ὄνυμα (ónuma, “name”).

adjectives.description: metonymic (comparative more metonymic, superlative most metonymic)

entries.meaning: Of, or relating to, a word or phrase that names an object from a single characteristic of it or of a closely related object.
examples: The British government is often referred to by the metonymic expression "Downing Street".

entries.meaning: Synonym of metonym, an instance of metonymy.
